Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: "It is very risky to be exposed to new construction… I don't want to tie my personal guarantee to it" (citing WSJ data on permits down in CA)
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: De-prioritize new-construction contractors. Only engage if clear backlog, low concentration, and strong maintenance mix exist.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: "Moving to California feels impractical… I will not be gone Monday through Friday"
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: Prioritize Greater Phoenix. Keep SoCal only for standout fits. Flag relocation logistics early.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: Broker asked for LOI before seller call; Pushkar refused
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: Don't submit LOIs without seller conversation. Keep working capital "normalized, set post-LOI."

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Key Moment / Trigger: Working capital intensity flagged as deal breaker
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: Heavy line-of-credit draws; said WC needs would "trash" his sleep
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: Avoid businesses with large ongoing working capital needs. Require normalized NWC included in price.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: "I don't want to be on the hook if one of these clients falls off"
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: Require performance-based seller notes tied to revenue or backlog when concentration exists.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: Passed on car-titles e-commerce: "at the mercy of Google... I don't want that anxiety"
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: De-prioritize SEO/PPC-dependent businesses. Favor recurring contracts.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Key Moment / Trigger: Parallel LOIs acceptable until spend required
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: Asked about pursuing both ABA and AppClarity until term sheets
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: Can hold two LOIs. Choose before paid diligence starts.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: Negotiated refundable escrow tied to APA; confirmed with lenders
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: Only accept escrow with clear milestones that counts toward down payment.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: "No... Johnny needs to be on the call"
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: Expect actual sellers on weekly checkpoints, not just intermediaries.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: ~96% Medicaid exposure; wants seller note forgiven if cuts hit
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: Require large standby notes with policy-tied forgiveness or walk.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Key Moment / Trigger: No early APAs or shortened diligence
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: Told broker "standard process or walk" when pushed for 25-day window
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: Maintain normal sequence: diligence first, then buyer-drafted APA.

Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Trigger / evidence: Met seller who "does three people's jobs"; said "is that the kind of life I want to sign up for? Not really"; wants weekly seller calls and a plan to add support quickly
Preference Changes (timestamped deltas).Impact: For MSPs, require an early staffing plan funded by working capital/LOC (and possibly higher equity) to hire 1–2 near-shore support in year one and keep the seller on 2–3 years; avoid single-person support models without this plan.

Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Questioned cash vs accrual, margin normalization, backlog strength
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Provide checklist for cash reconciliation and backlog verification

Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Asked Ryan to walk through 7(a) vs 504, seller notes, NWC placement
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Practice with live deals; plan legal review for first serious LOI

Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Asked if buyers "buy cash"; agreed NWC set post-diligence
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Share NWC checklist; request AR/AP aging early

Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Asked how to structure forgivable notes without earnouts
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Provide plain-English examples tied to revenue or backlog

Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Adjusted SDE to include $200k for 10% partner staying long-term
Negotiated refundable escrow counting toward equity
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Share sample clauses and lender confirmation examples

Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Nidhi leads lender packages while he runs equity raise
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Provide templates for business plan, SWOT, operator pitch

Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Learned about term working capital and revolvers at close
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Build cash-cushion plan with LOC examples

Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Pulled 350-page court filing; requested fee schedules
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Share Medicaid diligence checklist and re-trade templates

Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Refused early APA; told broker "standard process or walk"
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Provide scripts for pushing back on rushed timelines

Learning & Growth Areas.New capability or mindset shift: AI-assisted early diligence in short windows
Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Planned to run a "QoE-lite" using LLMs to reconcile cash to books, flag issues, and set a working capital peg within the MSP's 25-day window before paying for QoE
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Provide an AI diligence checklist, sample prompts, and 3–5 manual tie-outs to validate findings

Learning & Growth Areas.New capability or mindset shift: Modeled higher equity and working capital to fund early hires and keep DSCR safe
Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Live screen-share modeling: tested 20% equity injection, added a working-capital tranche/LOC, and budgeted 1–2 near-shore support hires; also mapped light hosted PBX capex (Dallas/PA)
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Draft a 12–18 month staffing plan (roles, timing, costs), include WC/LOC in sources and uses, and prep lender-friendly notes

Learning & Growth Areas.New capability or mindset shift: Arizona licensing path clarified for trades
Learning & Growth Areas.Evidence: Learned his engineering degree counts toward two years of experience; needs about two years of qualifier coverage
Learning & Growth Areas.Support needed / next coaching step: Share qualifier agreement templates and a two-year compliance checklist

Success Patterns.Resonates: Recurring revenue, clear backlog, local Phoenix operations
Success Patterns.Repels: New-construction heavy, unclear financials, required relocation
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Prioritize Phoenix service trades and healthcare with sticky demand

Success Patterns.Resonates: Clean process (seller call before LOI, full P&L provided)
Success Patterns.Repels: Brokers gatekeeping information or pushing premature LOIs
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Avoid brokers requiring LOI before seller meeting

Success Patterns.Resonates: Normalized NWC included in price, clear AR/AP reports
Success Patterns.Repels: Heavy working capital needs, combined financials, buyer-funded NWC
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Require detailed working capital reports early

Success Patterns.Repels: Being liable if key customer or project falls through
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Include forgivable seller notes tied to revenue/backlog

Success Patterns.Resonates: Needs-based businesses not dependent on algorithms
Success Patterns.Repels: Google traffic or paid-ad dependent models
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Favor local clinics and B2B services with contracts

Success Patterns.Resonates: Running parallel deals until term sheets arrive
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Get term sheets early; use takeaway closes for stalls

Success Patterns.Resonates: Escrow tied to milestones and counting toward equity
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Make escrow refundable with written release terms

Success Patterns.Resonates: Weekly checkpoints with actual decision makers
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Ensure sellers attend checkpoint calls directly

Success Patterns.Resonates: Policy-tied seller notes for Medicaid risk
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Require standby notes with forgiveness triggers

Success Patterns.Resonates: Normal diligence sequence with 60-90 day windows
Success Patterns.Repels: Early APAs and arbitrary short timelines
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Use firm scripts to maintain standard process

Success Patterns.Resonates: Researching broker's listings and deal sizes to calibrate and push for a normal sequence
Success Patterns.Repels: Template APAs, talk of "non-binding" exclusivity and backup APAs during exclusivity, and gatekeeping seller contact
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Arm him with simple scripts and keep seller involved directly; expect friction with small-deal brokers and plan weekly seller calls

Success Patterns.Resonates: Using higher equity and a working-capital tranche/LOC to hire near-shore support early and protect DSCR; small capex tied to recurring hosted PBX growth
Success Patterns.Repels: Multi-year solo support slog and heavy key person risk
Success Patterns.Implication for recommendations: Only advance owner-dependent MSPs that can fund 1–2 early support hires and keep the seller for 2–3 years; filter out single-person support models without this path
